cards.flavor: "Justice isn't done until undeath is undone."
cards.name: Angel of Glory's Rise
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Glory's Rise enters the battlefield, exile all Zombies, then return all Human creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "Though Innistrad is not cleansed of evil, we finally have cause to rejoice."
cards.name: Angel of Jubilation
cards.text:
Flying
Other nonblack creatures you control get +1/+1.
Players can't pay life or sacrifice creatures to cast spells or activate abilities.

cards.flavor: "I understand your fears. I pity your doubts. I absolve you of both."
cards.name: Angel's Mercy
cards.text: You gain 7 life.

cards.flavor:
"The air stirred as if fanned by angels' wings, and the enemy was turned aside."
—Tales of Ikarov the Voyager
cards.name: Angelic Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying

cards.flavor: The sky rang with the cries of armored seraphs, and the darkness made a tactical retreat.
cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: A golden helix streaked skyward from the Helvault. A thunderous explosion shattered the silver monolith and Avacyn emerged, free from her prison at last.
cards.name: Avacyn, Angel of Hope
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, indestructible
Other permanents you control have indestructible.

cards.name: Banishing Stroke
cards.text:
Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on the bottom of its owner's library.
Miracle {W} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor:
"Mix the mortar with holy wards, or blood will run in the streets."
—Vadvar, Thraben stonewright
cards.name: Builder's Blessing
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.flavor: Grace is a gift, never a reward.
cards.name: Call to Serve
cards.text:
Enchant nonblack creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2, has flying, and is an Angel in addition to its other types.

cards.flavor: Avacyn's holy warriors kept hope alive in her darkest hours. Now they will carry that hope across Innistrad.
cards.name: Cathars' Crusade
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: "Evil will soon be vanquished. What Innistrad most needs now is healing."
cards.name: Cathedral Sanctifier
cards.text: When Cathedral Sanctifier enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"Even storm clouds bow to worship Avacyn."
—Elder Rimheit
cards.name: Cloudshift
cards.text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: "Wear her symbol with honor, a sign of faith upheld and honest deeds bravely done."
cards.name: Commander's Authority
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield."

cards.flavor: No longer the village pariah. No longer taunted and shamed. Sigrun was finally free.
cards.name: Cursebreak
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Once vampires are disarmed, they're given wooden swords and forced to assist in the training of Midnight Duelists.
cards.name: Defang
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: Gisela cornered the murderous demon among the graves of the dead villagers. "A fitting end," she murmured as she raised her sword.
cards.name: Defy Death
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's an Angel, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: "By Avacyn's decree, we shall cleanse these relics of their demonic past."
cards.name: Devout Chaplain
cards.text: {T}, Tap two untapped Humans you control: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Divine Deflection
cards.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to you and/or permanents you control this turn. If damage is prevented this way, Divine Deflection deals that much damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "You have done your best. I give you leave to rest."
cards.name: Emancipation Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Emancipation Angel enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Entreat the Angels
cards.text:
Put X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Miracle {X}{W}{W} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor: "I'd slog through a thousand swamps to help one soul find rest."
cards.name: Farbog Explorer
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: "One faith, but many hands in victory."
cards.name: Goldnight Commander
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering.
cards.name: Goldnight Redeemer
cards.text:
Flying
When Goldnight Redeemer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each other creature you control.

cards.name: Herald of War
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Herald of War attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Angel spells and Human spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Herald of War.

cards.flavor: Her eyes see through the rotting flesh and glimpse a soul in agony, begging for the Blessed Sleep.
cards.name: Holy Justiciar
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature. If that creature is a Zombie, exile it.

cards.flavor: The finest maneuvers take place in three dimensions.
cards.name: Leap of Faith
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn.

cards.flavor: Avacyn's return did not rid him of his desire for revenge.
cards.name: Midnight Duelist
cards.text: Protection from Vampires

cards.flavor: "I cultivated my faith in Avacyn despite meager returns. Now my faith is repaid."
cards.name: Midvast Protector
cards.text: When Midvast Protector enters the battlefield, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Wails and whispers are the only weapons she has left.
cards.name: Moonlight Geist
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Moonlight Geist this turn.

cards.flavor: Inquisitors are taught scripture, philosophy, and the fine art of sharpening an axe.
cards.name: Moorland Inquisitor
cards.text: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Nearheath Pilgrim
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nearheath Pilgrim is paired with another creature, both creatures have lifelink.

cards.name: Restoration Angel
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Restoration Angel enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Angel creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Riders of Gavony
cards.text:
Vigilance
As Riders of Gavony enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Human creatures you control have protection from creatures of the chosen type.

cards.flavor:
"Monsters will no longer find safety under the mists of Morkrut!"
—Bruna, Light of Alabaster
cards.name: Righteous Blow
cards.text: Righteous Blow deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: She parts the clouds so sunlight can reach even the darkest lairs and duskiest tombs.
cards.name: Seraph of Dawn
cards.text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Silverblade Paladin
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Silverblade Paladin is paired with another creature, both creatures have double strike.

cards.name: Spectral Gateguards
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Spectral Gateguards is paired with another creature, both creatures have vigilance.

cards.name: Terminus
cards.text:
Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries.
Miracle {W} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor: "Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."
cards.name: Thraben Valiant
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor: Her horn is heard across Innistrad, lifting the hearts of the righteous.
cards.name: Voice of the Provinces
cards.text:
Flying
When Voice of the Provinces enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."
cards.name: Zealous Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Side effects may include foul odors, scalding steam, and spontaneous nonexistence.
cards.name: Alchemist's Apprentice
cards.text: Sacrifice Alchemist's Apprentice: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "I knew I'd find a use for all that newt spittle!"
cards.name: Amass the Components
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.

cards.flavor: Debates between wizards are never purely academic.
cards.name: Arcane Melee
cards.text: Instant and sorcery spells cost {2} less to cast.

cards.flavor: "I am no mere ship's captain. The north wind is my accomplice. The tide is my first mate."
cards.name: Captain of the Mists
cards.text:
Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, untap Captain of the Mists.
{1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent.

cards.flavor: One breath of the geist turns veins to rivers of ice and freezes hearts midbeat.
cards.name: Crippling Chill
cards.text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Deadeye Navigator
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Deadeye Navigator is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{1}{U}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield under your control."

cards.flavor: It's hard to argue with a force made of divine will.
cards.name: Devastation Tide
cards.text:
Return all nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
Miracle {1}{U} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor: Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you.
cards.name: Dreadwaters
cards.text: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Elgaud Shieldmate
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Elgaud Shieldmate is paired with another creature, both creatures have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: Long thought to be extinct, flocks of gryffs reappeared with Avacyn's return.
cards.name: Favorable Winds
cards.text: Creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The choices of the living will tether them in death.
cards.name: Fettergeist
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Fettergeist unless you pay {1} for each other creature you control.

cards.flavor: The first spell taught to young mages, it has spared the lives of many whose hands are too small to hold a sword.
cards.name: Fleeting Distraction
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Galvanic Alchemist
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Galvanic Alchemist is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{2}{U}: Untap this creature."

cards.flavor: Angels and demons aren't the only ones listening to your prayers.
cards.name: Geist Snatch
cards.text: Counter target creature spell. Put a 1/1 blue Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "There's no such thing as ‘impenetrable.'"
cards.name: Ghostform
cards.text: Up to two target creatures can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Sometimes it's useful to take a break from existence.
cards.name: Ghostly Flicker
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts, creatures, and/or lands you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: "Geists wish to make themselves known. I'm merely the vessel for their efforts."
cards.name: Ghostly Touch
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Whenever this creature attacks, you may tap or untap target permanent."

cards.flavor:
"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."
—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir
cards.name: Gryff Vanguard
cards.text:
Flying
When Gryff Vanguard enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: An abomination so violent that the other fiends tremble at the sight of it.
cards.name: Havengul Skaab
cards.text: Whenever Havengul Skaab attacks, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Infinite Reflection
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Infinite Reflection enters the battlefield attached to a creature, each other nontoken creature you control becomes a copy of that creature.
Nontoken creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of enchanted creature.

cards.flavor:
"The cathars have their swords, the inquisitors their axes. I prefer the ‘diplomatic' approach."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau
cards.name: Into the Void
cards.text: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: It seeks a tomb that will hold it, a coffin that will give it rest.
cards.name: Latch Seeker
cards.text: Latch Seeker can't be blocked.

cards.name: Lone Revenant
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Lone Revenant deals combat damage to a player, if you control no other creatures, look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
"I'm pleased this world has learned the moon affects more than the tides."
—Tamiyo, the Moon Sage
cards.name: Lunar Mystic
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "We have emerged triumphant from the darkness. Let our hard-won wisdom guide us to prosperity."
cards.name: Mass Appeal
cards.text: Draw a card for each Human you control.

cards.flavor:
"When you see a raven, head for the hills. It knows when the ghost-tide is headed in."
—Sved, fisherman of Nephalia
cards.name: Mist Raven
cards.text:
Flying
When Mist Raven enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: For some creatures, existing is only a whim.
cards.name: Misthollow Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
You may cast Misthollow Griffin from exile.

cards.flavor: "My drivers are trustworthy. I removed their tongues myself. Any other questions?"
cards.name: Nephalia Smuggler
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: The student asks how a spell is begun. The master ponders what ends it.
cards.name: Outwit
cards.text: Counter target spell that targets a player.

cards.flavor: "Soulless demon, you are bound to me. Now we will both dwell in oblivion."
cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor:
"Don't look into its eyes. It's thinking things no dead thing should think."
—Captain Eberhart
cards.name: Rotcrown Ghoul
cards.text: When Rotcrown Ghoul dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.name: Scrapskin Drake
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Scrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.

cards.flavor:
"I see where you're going with that. I don't like it."
—Dierk, geistmage
cards.name: Second Guess
cards.text: Counter target spell that's the second spell cast this turn.

cards.name: Spectral Prison
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice Spectral Prison.

cards.flavor: The fear of slipping from the geist's tenuous grip overwhelmed Tolo's joy at his first flight.
cards.name: Spirit Away
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

cards.name: Stern Mentor
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Stern Mentor is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard."

cards.name: Stolen Goods
cards.text: Target opponent exiles cards from the top of his or her library until he or she exiles a nonland card. Until end of turn, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Tamiyo, the Moon Sage
cards.text:
+1: Tap target permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
−2: Draw a card for each tapped creature target player controls.
−8: You get an emblem with "You have no maximum hand size" and "Whenever a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, you may return it to your hand."

cards.name: Tandem Lookout
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Tandem Lookout is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."

cards.flavor: Time is a marvelous plaything.
cards.name: Temporal Mastery
cards.text:
Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Temporal Mastery.
Miracle {1}{U} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Vanishment
cards.text:
Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
Miracle {U} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Wingcrafter
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Wingcrafter is paired with another creature, both creatures have flying.

cards.flavor: Just as with a peach, the first bite is always the juiciest.
cards.name: Appetite for Brains
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it with converted mana cost 4 or greater and exile that card.

cards.flavor:
"We must all make sacrifices for the good of Innistrad."
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Barter in Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

cards.flavor: "Great art can never be created without great suffering."
cards.name: Blood Artist
cards.text: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"Death not for survival but for vanity and pleasure? This is the decadence I sought to curb."
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Bloodflow Connoisseur
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Bloodflow Connoisseur.

cards.flavor:
"Which do you deserve, the heft of a femur or the graceful sharpness of a forearm? Decisions, decisions . . ."
—Gisa the Mad
cards.name: Bone Splinters
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Bone Splinters, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor: Without a mind, it doesn't fear death. Without a soul, it doesn't mind killing.
cards.name: Butcher Ghoul
cards.text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Those without breath can't complain.
cards.name: Corpse Traders
cards.text: {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor:
"I guess what they say is true. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Or at least stranger."
—Captain Eberhart
cards.name: Crypt Creeper
cards.text: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.

cards.flavor: "Ah, this is a nice life. I can see why you were so desperate to keep it."
cards.name: Dark Impostor
cards.text:
{4}{B}{B}: Exile target creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Dark Impostor.
Dark Impostor has all activated abilities of all creature cards exiled with it.

cards.flavor: Leukin stared at the smoldering angel feathers. "Run!" he screamed to his patrol. "We don't stand a chance!"
cards.name: Death Wind
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Which is the greater folly, summoning the demon or expecting gratitude from it?
cards.name: Demonic Rising
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if you control exactly one creature, put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Subservience to greater power is the only law in the pit.
cards.name: Demonic Taskmaster
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Demonic Taskmaster.

cards.name: Demonlord of Ashmouth
cards.text:
Flying
When Demonlord of Ashmouth enters the battlefield, exile it unless you sacrifice another creature.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: The stairs lead down in both directions.
cards.name: Descent into Madness
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a despair counter on Descent into Madness, then each player exiles X permanents he or she controls and/or cards from his or her hand, where X is the number of despair counters on Descent into Madness.

cards.flavor: Half a brain rules the mindless.
cards.name: Dread Slaver
cards.text: Whenever a creature dealt damage by Dread Slaver this turn dies, return it to the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.flavor: Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.
cards.name: Driver of the Dead
cards.text: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Captain Lewenheart uncovered evidence of a demon cult among the clergy. The Skirsdag never gave him a chance to prove his case.
cards.name: Essence Harvest
cards.text: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

cards.name: Evernight Shade
cards.text:
{B}: Evernight Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Even as humans regained the upper hand, some still willingly traded their lives for a chance at immortality.
cards.name: Exquisite Blood
cards.text: Whenever an opponent loses life, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor: The body dies in stages. First the skin, then the muscle. The brain is last, much to the victim's dismay.
cards.name: Ghoulflesh
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.flavor: He roams the streets of Havengul seeking the sick and delirious so that he may cure them of their lives.
cards.name: Gloom Surgeon
cards.text: If combat damage would be dealt to Gloom Surgeon, prevent that damage and exile that many cards from the top of your library.

cards.flavor:
"It's a cold, dark journey either way."
—Eruth of Lambholt
cards.name: Grave Exchange
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. Target player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor:
"Avacyn emerged from the broken Helvault, but her freedom came at a price—him."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Griselbrand
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Pay 7 life: Draw seven cards.

cards.flavor:
"He is judge, jury, and executioner because he killed them all."
—Bishop Cawle of Elgaud
cards.name: Harvester of Souls
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever another nontoken creature dies, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Damned crows and their endless squawking . . . blocks out the voices in my head . . ."
—Hermit of Hanne Hall
cards.name: Homicidal Seclusion
cards.text: As long as you control exactly one creature, that creature gets +3/+1 and has lifelink.

cards.flavor:
"I have seen a hundred mortal families rise and fall. I shall outlast a thousand more."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.name: Human Frailty
cards.text: Destroy target Human creature.

cards.flavor: Even after Hanweir was saved, Gisa's lost ghouls would shamble through, still following the twisted orders of their imprisoned master.
cards.name: Hunted Ghoul
cards.text: Hunted Ghoul can't block Humans.

cards.flavor:
"I come looking for demons and I find a plane full of angels. I hate angels."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Killing Wave
cards.text: For each creature, its controller sacrifices it unless he or she pays X life.

cards.flavor:
"Who am I to break up a family?"
—Gisa the Mad
cards.name: Maalfeld Twins
cards.text: When Maalfeld Twins dies, put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"No matter how far we push into Stensia, undeath will always remain in these lands."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau
cards.name: Marrow Bats
cards.text:
Flying
Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats.

cards.flavor: "His mind is feeble. Feed him to the bats."
cards.name: Mental Agony
cards.text: Target player discards two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: An undead snake doesn't bite in self-defense. It hungers as any zombie, never sated.
cards.name: Necrobite
cards.text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. Regenerate it. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: After the zombie attack, crops withered on the vine, and the thriving village became a ghost town almost overnight.
cards.name: Polluted Dead
cards.text: When Polluted Dead dies, destroy target land.

cards.name: Predator's Gambit
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
Enchanted creature has intimidate as long as its controller controls no other creatures. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor:
"Have you ever cornered a wounded vampire? That's a walk in the cathedral garden in comparison."
—Tristen, Cathar Marshal
cards.name: Renegade Demon

cards.flavor: It rises with the fall of darkness, seeking souls to extinguish.
cards.name: Searchlight Geist
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{B}: Searchlight Geist gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: Vowing to free the souls of her children, Kastinne followed the tormentors into the ghastly network of caves below Stensia.
cards.name: Soulcage Fiend
cards.text: When Soulcage Fiend dies, each player loses 3 life.

cards.name: Treacherous Pit-Dweller
cards.text:
When Treacherous Pit-Dweller enters the battlefield from a graveyard, target opponent gains control of it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"I've seen corpses prettier than you, beastmage."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Triumph of Cruelty
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

cards.flavor: Heartless killer in life, brainless killer in death.
cards.name: Undead Executioner
cards.text: When Undead Executioner dies, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave.
cards.name: Unhallowed Pact
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
"Barbarians! They burned my favorite chair! We'll kill them all!"
—Anje Falkenrath
cards.name: Aggravate
cards.text: Aggravate deals 1 damage to each creature target player controls. Each creature dealt damage this way attacks this turn if able.

cards.flavor: Swifter than an angel, crueler than a demon, and relentless as a ghoul.
cards.name: Archwing Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Archwing Dragon to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: After the destruction of the Helvault, fearful mobs soon became fearless battalions.
cards.name: Banners Raised
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"A church is just wood and walls. A congregation is the faithful praising the angels."
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf
cards.name: Battle Hymn
cards.text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each creature you control.

cards.name: Bonfire of the Damned
cards.text:
Bonfire of the Damned deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
Miracle {X}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Burn at the Stake
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Burn at the Stake, tap any number of untapped creatures you control.
Burn at the Stake deals damage to target creature or player equal to three times the number of creatures tapped this way.

cards.flavor:
"C'mon friend, take a turn tossing the knucklebones. What've you got to lose?"
—Tobias, trader of Erdwal
cards.name: Dangerous Wager
cards.text: Discard your hand, then draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
"To truly defeat a skaberen, you must destroy not the monster but the lab."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.flavor: Hours after the Helvault opened, his powers returned twice as strong as before.
cards.name: Dual Casting
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy."

cards.name: Falkenrath Exterminator
cards.text:
Whenever Falkenrath Exterminator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}{R}: Falkenrath Exterminator deals damage to target creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Falkenrath Exterminator.

cards.flavor: "I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."
cards.name: Fervent Cathar
cards.text:
Haste
When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"
—Gregel, township militia
cards.name: Gang of Devils
cards.text: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor:
"Fire will eventually destroy a zombie, but a fiery zombie destroys a lot of other things first."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.name: Guise of Fire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Hanweir Lancer
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Hanweir Lancer is paired with another creature, both creatures have first strike.

cards.flavor: "That slowly decreasing pulse—that's the beat I waltz to."
cards.name: Havengul Vampire
cards.text:
Whenever Havengul Vampire deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Havengul Vampire.

cards.name: Heirs of Stromkirk
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever Heirs of Stromkirk deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Hound of Griselbrand
cards.text:
Double strike
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Discontent is a powerful weapon in the hands of a mob.
cards.name: Kessig Malcontents
cards.text: When Kessig Malcontents enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to the number of Humans you control.

cards.flavor: Unhappy with the creation of the wolfir, Rorica broke with her order and led a crusade against the "reformed werewolves."
cards.name: Kruin Striker
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Kruin Striker gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Mauler
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Lightning Mauler is paired with another creature, both creatures have haste.

cards.flavor: "Undead flesh is dry and papery. A single spark and ‘poof.' No more ghoul."
cards.name: Lightning Prowess
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste and "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.flavor: "There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"
cards.name: Mad Prophet
cards.text:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: As peace returned to Thraben, some cathars made the mistake of letting down their guard.
cards.name: Malicious Intent
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."

cards.flavor: It descended on Estwald like a sudden storm. Moments later, only ashes and agony remained.
cards.name: Malignus
cards.text:
Malignus's power and toughness are each equal to half the highest life total among your opponents, rounded up.
Damage that would be dealt by Malignus can't be prevented.

cards.flavor: "May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion."
cards.name: Pillar of Flame
cards.text: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: Some tried cremating their dead to stop the ghoulcallers. But the dead returned, furious about their fate.
cards.name: Raging Poltergeist

cards.flavor: In a wave of spells called the Cursemute, Avacyn cleansed the world with divine fire.
cards.name: Reforge the Soul
cards.text:
Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.
Miracle {1}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor: "So the vampires like hot blood, do they? Let's see how they handle ours."
cards.name: Riot Ringleader
cards.text: Whenever Riot Ringleader attacks, Human creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Skirsdag cultists refused to quietly accept Avacyn's ascendancy.
cards.name: Rite of Ruin
cards.text: Choose an order for artifacts, creatures, and lands. Each player sacrifices one permanent of the first type, sacrifices two of the second type, then sacrifices three of the third type.

cards.flavor: Sometimes it's not for sustenance or to feed the dependence. Sometimes it's just to feel again.
cards.name: Rush of Blood
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.flavor: Demons massacre. Devils annoy.
cards.name: Scalding Devil
cards.text: {2}{R}: Scalding Devil deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: He has nothing left but his resentment.
cards.name: Somberwald Vigilante
cards.text: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Stonewright
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Stonewright is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.flavor: The dark times left the peasantry ready to fight with whatever weapons were at hand.
cards.name: Thatcher Revolt
cards.text: Put three 1/1 red Human creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield. Sacrifice those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"My next aerial design will use less metal."
—Hadaken, alchemist of Nephalia
cards.name: Thunderbolt
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player.
• Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Thunderous Wrath
cards.text:
Thunderous Wrath deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
Miracle {R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
−4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
−6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Tyrant of Discord
cards.text: When Tyrant of Discord enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a permanent he or she controls at random and sacrifices it. If a nonland permanent is sacrificed this way, repeat this process.

cards.flavor:
"To survive, we must embrace the savagery we knew in our race's infancy."
—Edgar Markov
cards.name: Uncanny Speed
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It's not any fun until someone loses an eye.
cards.name: Vexing Devil
cards.text: When Vexing Devil enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 4 damage to him or her. If a player does, sacrifice Vexing Devil.

cards.flavor: It begins as a whisper and ends with the red roar of fire.
cards.name: Vigilante Justice
cards.text: Whenever a Human enters the battlefield under your control, Vigilante Justice deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Zealous Conscripts
cards.text:
Haste
When Zealous Conscripts enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Abundant Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Blessings of Nature
cards.text:
Distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.flavor: "There's only one route from Kessig into Stensia. Unless you come with me."
cards.name: Borderland Ranger
cards.text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: In the darkest hours, some denied Avacyn. Now the Kessig wilds are their only haven.
cards.name: Bower Passage
cards.text: Creatures with flying can't block creatures you control.

cards.name: Champion of Lambholt
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.

cards.flavor: Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow.
cards.name: Craterhoof Behemoth
cards.text:
Haste
When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Descendants' Path
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card that shares a creature type with a creature you control, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Diregraf Escort
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Diregraf Escort is paired with another creature, both creatures have protection from Zombies.

cards.name: Druid's Familiar
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Druid's Familiar is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Druids' Repository
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, put a charge counter on Druids' Repository.
Remove a charge counter from Druids' Repository: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: After sampling many victims, the spider developed a preference for the undead and their accoutrements.
cards.name: Eaten by Spiders
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying and all Equipment attached to that creature.

cards.flavor:
"It used to eat us trappers. Now it follows us around like some kind of hound dog."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
cards.name: Flowering Lumberknot
cards.text: Flowering Lumberknot can't attack or block unless it's paired with a creature with soulbond.

cards.name: Geist Trappers
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Geist Trappers is paired with another creature, both creatures have reach.

cards.flavor: The abandoned towns on the moors didn't stay empty for long.
cards.name: Gloomwidow
cards.text:
Reach
Gloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.

cards.flavor:
"We've tracked Ludevic's monster across four provinces. When it lands, make sure it stays put."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig,
to Halana of Ulvenwald
cards.name: Grounded
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.

cards.name: Howlgeist
cards.text:
Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"By my power, werewolves shall become the wolfir, our allies in combat against darkness."
—Avacyn's Cursemute Decree
cards.name: Joint Assault
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's paired with a creature, that creature also gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The fiends have fled. Well, good riddance. Nothing I like more than an empty lair."
cards.name: Lair Delve
cards.text: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put all creature and land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: The haunted blade shattered, and the geist drifted gratefully to the Blessed Sleep.
cards.name: Natural End
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"I killed one and found bricks and bones in its belly. It had eaten a whole cottage, thatch and all."
—Paulin, Somberwald trapper
cards.name: Nettle Swine
Nightshade Peddler
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nightshade Peddler is paired with another creature, both creatures have deathtouch.

cards.name: Pathbreaker Wurm
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Pathbreaker Wurm is paired with another creature, both creatures have trample.

cards.flavor: With Avacyn's return, the flow of life became a tidal wave.
cards.name: Primal Surge
cards.text: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you do, repeat this process.

cards.flavor: When the forests became havens for evil, the archmages devised new ways to cleanse the wilds.
cards.name: Rain of Thorns
cards.text:
Choose one or more —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Destroy target land.

cards.name: Revenge of the Hunted
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target creature gets +6/+6 and gains trample, and all creatures able to block it this turn do so.
Miracle {G} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

cards.name: Sheltering Word
cards.text: Target creature you control gains hexproof until end of turn. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (A creature with hexproof can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: A hunter's precision and a durkvine's strength are a potent combination.
cards.name: Snare the Skies
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: "You can face any danger when all of nature is on your side."
cards.name: Somberwald Sage
cards.text: {T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

cards.flavor: It's there when a seed sprouts, when gourds ripen on the vines, and when the reapers cut the grains under the Harvest Moon.
cards.name: Soul of the Harvest
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: Elmut had slaughtered vampires, slain werewolves, and destroyed hordes of zombies. Sadly, he never got over his fear of spiders.
cards.name: Terrifying Presence
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: "Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."
cards.name: Timberland Guide
cards.text: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Rid me of this curse, witch, or die with me."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Triumph of Ferocity
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

cards.name: Trusted Forcemage
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Trusted Forcemage is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +1/+1.

cards.flavor: "Peace will come to Innistrad, but only after all abominations have been dealt with, one by one."
cards.name: Ulvenwald Tracker
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor:
"Where'd the werewolves go? Maybe that got hungry."
—Halana of Ulvenwald
cards.name: Vorstclaw

cards.flavor: Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved.
cards.name: Wandering Wolf
cards.text: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.

cards.flavor:
"When civilization reaches out its greedy hand, take it off at the wrist."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Wild Defiance
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The geists that dwell in the deep forests of Kessig are as untamable as the woods themselves.
cards.name: Wildwood Geist
cards.text: Wildwood Geist gets +2/+2 as long as it's your turn.

cards.flavor: Released from a dark curse and bound to a higher calling.
cards.name: Wolfir Avenger
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Wolfir Avenger.

cards.name: Wolfir Silverheart
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Wolfir Silverheart is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +4/+4.

cards.flavor:
"I wonder what dwelled in the primordial forests before humans existed."
—Elder Rimheit
cards.name: Yew Spirit
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Yew Spirit gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

cards.name: Bruna, Light of Alabaster
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Bruna, Light of Alabaster attacks or blocks, you may attach to it any number of Auras on the battlefield and you may put onto the battlefield attached to it any number of Aura cards that could enchant it from your graveyard and/or hand.

cards.name: Gisela, Blade of Goldnight
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
If a source would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, that source deals double that damage to that player or permanent instead.
If a source would deal damage to you or a permanent you control, prevent half that damage, rounded up.

cards.flavor: Great devotion yields great reward.
cards.name: Sigarda, Host of Herons
cards.text:
Flying, hexproof
Spells and abilities your opponents control can't cause you to sacrifice permanents.

cards.flavor:
"Faith can quicken the stones themselves with life."
—Writings of Mikaeus
cards.name: Angel's Tomb
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Angel's Tomb become a 3/3 white Angel artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Forged in dark hours from the flame that would not die.
cards.name: Angelic Armaments
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and is a white Angel in addition to its other colors and types.
Equip {4}

cards.flavor: Forged from the rubble of the Helvault.
cards.name: Bladed Bracers
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human or an Angel, it has vigilance.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic
cards.name: Conjurer's Closet
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Gallows at Willow Hill
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Tap three untapped Humans you control: Destroy target creature. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Drain the victim's blood, sell the corpse, and use the soul on guard duty. No muss, no fuss, no problems."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.name: Haunted Guardian
cards.text: Defender, first strike

cards.name: Moonsilver Spear

cards.flavor:
"Finally, the principles of corpse animation applied to bloodless materials!"
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.name: Narstad Scrapper
cards.text: {2}: Narstad Scrapper gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Any fool can open it. But it takes a genius to decipher the blank pages."
—Kordel the Cryptic
cards.name: Otherworld Atlas
cards.text:
{T}: Put a charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.
{T}: Each player draws a card for each charge counter on Otherworld Atlas.

cards.flavor: Words to bless the eye that reads them, telling of a future beyond the reach of fear.
cards.name: Scroll of Avacyn
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Avacyn: Draw a card. If you control an Angel, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: Words no eyes should see, telling of things no sane mind could fathom.
cards.name: Scroll of Griselbrand
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Scroll of Griselbrand: Target opponent discards a card. If you control a Demon, that player loses 3 life.

cards.flavor: To a demon there is no such thing as restraint.
cards.name: Tormentor's Trident
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and attacks each turn if able.
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: Wars are not fought on a single front.
cards.name: Vanguard's Shield
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+3 and can block an additional creature.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Vessel of Endless Rest
cards.text:
When Vessel of Endless Rest enters the battlefield, put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Persecuted alchemists fled deep into Kessig's wilds, seeking solitude to continue their ghoulish craft.
cards.name: Alchemist's Refuge
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G}{U}, {T}: You may cast nonland cards this turn as though they had flash.

cards.name: Cavern of Souls
cards.text:
As Cavern of Souls enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a creature spell of the chosen type, and that spell can't be countered.

cards.flavor: A lonely sentinel facing gales, hurricanes, and tides of homicidal spirits.
cards.name: Desolate Lighthouse
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{R}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Seraph Sanctuary
cards.text:
When Seraph Sanctuary enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
Whenever an Angel enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Its courtyards are lit during every hour of the day so that night may never fall within its walls.
cards.name: Slayers' Stronghold
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains vigilance and haste until end of turn.
